intro: Argentina luteopilosa, commonly known as the yellow-haired grass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grass species. Argentina luteopilosa is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its name reflects the yellow color of its inflorescence and the hairy texture of its foliage.
